title: Game music, ehncanged, ripped and converted songs

title: Re: Game music, ehncanged, ripped and converted songs
content:
Okay, well here's something. I haven't had a chance to work on fixing the issue with my improvements to the Adlib synth, but the file below both sounds good and gives you an idea of what it is I'm trying to fix.

[url=http://www.shikadi.net/gamemusic/cavebash.ogg]cavebash.ogg[/url]

You'll notice at about 0:43 and 1:42 there's a really low note - much lower than it should be and it sounds quite out of place. A lot of songs are doing something along these lines and although I have a pretty good idea why, it's just a matter of me sitting down and figuring out a satisfactory solution to it. There are a few other places in the song where this happens, but they're not as noticeable as the two times above.

Oh, and if you've ever played Vinyl Goddess from Mars, the [url=http://www.shikadi.net/gamemusic/vinylintro.ogg]theme music[/url] rocks [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: Game music, ehncanged, ripped and converted songs
content:
Well, I have been Lastly recording Music from old DOS games to MP3 using DOSBox, and it turns out really cool! Of course, I've also recorded the full soundtrack of all The Commander Keen Series! (Well, at least the only ones that have music...[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img] )
I also recorded Jill of the Jungle, 4D Boxing, and more!Couldn't he just use the pogo!?

title: Re: Game music, ehncanged, ripped and converted songs
content:
That's good, it's always nice to have someone else who's into game music [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

But did you know that all the Keen music is available in IMF format, extracted directly from the game itself? These files are much smaller than MP3s (the entire Keen 4-6 soundtrack is the same size as a ~20 second MP3), and you can play them in Winamp. You can also use Winamp to convert them to .wav which is usually better than DOSBox since you get the proper length of the song (otherwise it can be difficult to know when the song loops.)

title: The music from Vinyl Goddess from Mars!!!
content: My 2nd favorite game music is the music from Vinyl Goddess from Mars.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]  [SARCASM]Of course it's better music than KEEN music!!![/SARCASM][img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]  Acutely, I like Keen 5 music much more.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [img]http://images.ucomics.com/comics/ga/2005/ga050705.gif[/img]
